        • crops.core.intervals module

    crops.core.intervals module¶

    class intinterval(description='intinterval', subint=[])[source]¶

    Bases: object

    An integer interval object. The integer interval class represents a data structure to hold all non-connected sub-intervals making it up, extra information tags, and set operations for the intervals. It contains functions to organise intervals and make operations on them.

    Parameters

    • description (str, optional) – An interval ID, defaults to ‘intinterval’.

    • subint (list) – A list of two-integer lists, defaults to [].

    Variables

    • tags – Useful information of the intinterval, including the default ‘description’.

    • subint – The list of sub-intervals in intinterval.

    Example

    >>> from crops.core import intervals
>>> my_interval = intinterval('an interval')
>>> other_interval = intinterval('another interval')
>>> my_interval = my_interval.union(15)
>>> my_interval2 = my_interval2.union([2,7])
>>> my_interval = my_interval.union(my_interval2)
>>> print(my_interval)
Integer interval object: (id="an interval", subsets="[[2,7],[15,15]]")
>>> print(my_interval.intersection([3,19]))
Integer interval object: (id="an interval", subsets="[[3,7],[15,15]]")
>>> my_interval.n_elements()
8
>>> my_interval.terminals()
[3,15]
>>> my_interval.contains(16)
False
>>> my_interval.contains(my_interval2)
False
>>> my_interval.contains([5,7])
True
    addtag(tag, value)[source]¶

    Adds a new tag to intinterval.

    Parameters

    • tag (str) – Key argument.

    • value (any) – Value argument.

    Raises

    TypeError – If tag is not a string.

    contains(other)[source]¶

    Checks if input interval is fully contained in self. B ⊂ A : A = self, B = other.

    Parameters

    other (int, list, intinterval) – Another interval.

    Returns

    Whether self contains other or not.

    Return type

    bool

    deltag(tag)[source]¶

    Deletes a tag from intinterval.

    Parameters

    tag (str) – Key argument.

    Raises

    TypeError – If argument is not a string.

    description(newdescription=None)[source]¶

    Returns or moifies the ‘description’ tag.

    Parameters

    newdescription (str, optional) – If given, the value of ‘description’ in tags is replaced by ‘newdescription’, defaults to None

    Returns

    If newdescription not given, the value of ‘description’ in tags is returned.

    Return type

    str

    intersection(other, newdesc=None)[source]¶

    A ⋂ B : A = self, B = other

    Parameters

    • other (int, list, intinterval) – Another interval.

    • newdesc (str, optional) – If given, description of returned interval, defaults to None.

    Returns

    The Intersection of both intervals.

    Return type

    intinterval

    kind = 'Integer interval'¶
    n_elements(other=None)[source]¶

    Returns the number of elements in the interval, subinterval, or any other set.

    Parameters

    other (int, list, intinterval, optional) – Input argument, defaults to None.

    Returns

    Number of elements in the interval (self if other is None, other otherwise).

    Return type

    int

    subint¶
    subtract(other, newdesc=None)[source]¶

    A B : A = self, B = other

    Parameters

    • other (int, list, intinterval) – Another interval.

    • newdesc (str, optional) – If given, description of returned interval, defaults to None.

    Returns

    The result of subtracting other from self.

    Return type

    intinterval

    symdiff(other, newdesc=None)[source]¶

    A Δ B : A = self, B = other

    Parameters

    • other (int, list, intinterval) – Another interval.

    • newdesc (str, optional) – If given, description of returned interval, defaults to None.

    Returns

    The Symmetric difference of both intervals.

    Return type

    intinterval

    tags¶
    terminals(other=None)[source]¶

    Returns the first and last element in the intinterval.

    Parameters

    other (int, list, intinterval, optional) – Defaults to None.

    Returns

    A list of two integers indicating lower and higher limits of the interval (self if other is None, other otherwise). If input is an empty interval, this function will return an empty list.

    Return type

    list

    union(other, newdesc=None)[source]¶

    A ⋃ B : A = self, B = other

    Parameters

    • other (int, list, intinterval) – Another interval.

    • newdesc (str, optional) – If given, description of returned interval, defaults to None.

    Returns

    The Union of both intervals.

    Return type

    intinterval
